sentences.en: Everything outside was dark and dreary.
Her face looked sallow and swollen in the dreary light.
sentences.cn: 在昏暗的光线中看上去她那蜡黄的脸有些浮肿.

sentences.en: Hurstwood's dreary state made its beauty become more and more vivid.
sentences.cn: 赫斯渥那令人沮丧的处境使得这些情景更加美丽迷人.

sentences.en: It is a dreary little town where few would choose to linger.
sentences.cn: 这是个沉闷的小镇，没几个人会愿意在此流连。

sentences.en: Its splendid gates had opened, admitting her from a cold, dreary outside.
sentences.cn: 禁城那些辉煌的大门都敞开了, 请她从寒冷的凄凉的外面进到了里面.

sentences.en: Oh, it was Heaven after the last dreary year!
sentences.cn: 啊, 经历了过去一年的暗淡日子,这里就是天堂了!

sentences.en: She had had a dreary day of it herself.
sentences.cn: 她自己已经为此生了一天的闷气.

sentences.en: She was tired of hearing the same dreary tale of drunkenness and violence.
sentences.cn: 她听够了那些关于酗酒和暴力的乏味故事.

sentences.en: The otherwise dreary book is enlivened by some very amusing illustrations.
sentences.cn: 这本枯燥乏味的书幸亏加了一些精彩的插图才变得生动有趣.
一成不变的、乏味的日常事务

sentences.en: They have an air of freedom, and they have not a dreary commitment to mean ambitious or love of comfort.
sentences.cn: 他们有一种自由自在的风度, 他们不沉溺于可鄙的追名逐利和对舒适生活的迷恋.

sentences.en: They have not a dreary commitment to mean ambitions.
sentences.cn: 他们不去无聊地追求卑鄙的野心.

sentences.en: You can thank your lucky stars that you don't have to go to this dreary reception.
sentences.cn: 你真走运,不用出席那死气沉沉的招待会.

words.tran_cn: 沉寂地；可怕地；令人厌倦地

trans.tran_cn: 沉寂的，阴沉的，令人厌烦的，枯燥的
trans.tran_en: dull and making you feel sad or bored
